title: For Sale:  Para Ordanance SF-45
postcontent:
I have for sale a Para Ordanance SF-45. This is a custom high capacity 1911 that was used by Para for the Special Forces trials. Comes with 5 magazines, has trijicon night sights, light rail, skeleton trigger and hammer, full length guide rod. Really an awesome combat pistol. 

I have ran just under 500 rounds through it. For anyone that knows Kimbers or Paras and the like, it takes that or more just to break in a hand gun with as close of tolerances these have. I basically kept bringing it to the range until it would cycle 100 rounds without a stoppage.

This is absolutly an outstanding firearm and the only reason I am selling it is that I have hands that are a little on the small side and prefer a single stack 1911 due to the fact that I have to change my grip to allow my thumb to hit the slide release during a reload.

That being said, I would like around $1,200 since I know it is worth that. Especially in this political climate, but I will negotiate slightly. I will consider trades for a single stack 1911 orand. 45acp carbine only. I really want a Ruger SR1911. No Springfields, Rock Islands.... been there done that.
Would also consider trades for a '70s 350-500cc Jap motorcycle in decent shape. Need not run, but must have good engine. 2 or 4 stroke.

Call or text Shane at REDACTED

title: For Sale:  Russian Mosin Nagant M-44 Carbine
postcontent:
In 1943 some 50,000 trials carbines were built specifically for urban combat and tested in battle as the Soviet Army marched through Germany at the close of WWII. They are essentially an M38 with an attached side-folding bayonet and were adopted in 1944 as the "7,62 mm Carbine, Model of the Year 1944", commonly known as the M44 in the US. The M44 is the only model of Mosin Nagant that was produced in significant quantities in the Soviet Union itself after WWII with production ending in 1948. It is also the model most widely duplicated by other countries during the Cold War. As with the M38, most production occurred at Izhevsk with Tula examples being less common and more sought after.

This is a Izhevsk model. Made in Soviet Union. 

Asking 175 ea obo. 

I have two just out if crate.
.

title: Want To Buy:  Dream AR build
postcontent:
I'm Dave, a disabled veteran who enjoys target shooting, or as I call it; "Group Therapy." I have been working on my dream AR build; basically a fully automatic rifle just like the rifles carried by our brave men and women in the armed forces every day...and very much like the one I carried when I had the honor and privilege to serve in the U.S. Army. In short, building a fully automatic custom AR is quite expensive involving government laws, regulations and of course taxes, tariffs and fees. While doing research early one morning, since sleep eluded me once more and which just so happens to be Veteran's day, (HOOAH!), I stumbled up this website and figured why not?!?

Now I know there are A LOT more noble causes and better reasons to donate money and I'm not asking anyone to give who is anti-gun, or does not have a few dollars to throw this way toward this nut, but as always and especially if I succeed with this crazy endeavor, I invite all my family and friends to join me at the range and shoot this and every other firearm I own. Truth be told I am a little embarrassed I did this, but since I already linked it to my Facebook account and it posted an update on my timeline, I’m already committed!

So if you can; GREAT! If you can’t, wish me luck and for those of you that know me know I will document every step of this journey in writing and of course, with pictures. J  Please feel free to spread the word as I’m curious to see how many like-minded people there are out there.

If this works, I will definitely use this site again, but for one of those more noble causes I wrote about earlier in this early morning rambling. If you can donate to the cause, please email me via the link below.

Thanks for looking and for your donations.

DG

http://www.gofundme.com/group-therapy

postcontent:

This ammo combines a lightweight HP projectile with a metal ball to put two holes on target with each pull of the trigger.  It got great reviews online, but I am not a fan of multi-projectile rounds and bought these by mistake.

title: For Sale:  Dream AR build
postcontent:
Dream AR Build

I'm Dave, a disabled veteran who enjoys target shooting, or as I call it; "Group Therapy." I have been working on my dream AR build; basically a fully automatic rifle just like the rifles carried by our brave men and women in the armed forces every day...and very much like the one I carried when I had the honor and privilege to serve in the U.S. Army. In short, building a fully automatic custom AR is quite expensive involving government laws, regulations and of course taxes, tariffs and fees. While doing research early one morning, since sleep eluded me once more and which just so happens to be Veteran's day, (HOOAH!), I stumbled up this website and figured why not?!?

Now I know there are A LOT more noble causes and better reasons to donate money and I'm not asking anyone to give who is anti-gun, or does not have a few dollars to throw this way toward this nut, but as always and especially if I succeed with this crazy endeavor, I invite all my family and friends to join me at the range and shoot this and every other firearm I own. Truth be told I am a little embarrassed I did this, but since I already linked it to my Facebook account and it posted an update on my timeline, I’m already committed!

So if you can; GREAT! If you can’t, wish me luck and for those of you that know me know I will document every step of this journey in writing and of course, with pictures. J  Please feel free to spread the word as I’m curious to see how many like-minded people there are out there.

If this works, I will definitely use this site again, but for one of those more noble causes I wrote about earlier in this early morning rambling. If you can donate to the cause, please email me via the link below.

Thanks for looking and for your donations.

DG

http://www.gofundme.com/group-therapy

title: Want To Buy:  Dream AR build
postcontent:
Dream AR Build

I'm Dave, a disabled veteran who enjoys target shooting, or as I call it; "Group Therapy." I have been working on my dream AR build; basically a fully automatic rifle just like the rifles carried by our brave men and women in the armed forces every day...and very much like the one I carried when I had the honor and privilege to serve in the U.S. Army. In short, building a fully automatic custom AR is quite expensive involving government laws, regulations and of course taxes, tariffs and fees. While doing research early one morning, since sleep eluded me once more and which just so happens to be Veteran's day, (HOOAH!), I stumbled up this website and figured why not?!?

Now I know there are A LOT more noble causes and better reasons to donate money and I'm not asking anyone to give who is anti-gun, or does not have a few dollars to throw this way toward this nut, but as always and especially if I succeed with this crazy endeavor, I invite all my family and friends to join me at the range and shoot this and every other firearm I own. Truth be told I am a little embarrassed I did this, but since I already linked it to my Facebook account and it posted an update on my timeline, I’m already committed!

So if you can; GREAT! If you can’t, wish me luck and for those of you that know me know I will document every step of this journey in writing and of course, with pictures. J  Please feel free to spread the word as I’m curious to see how many like-minded people there are out there.

If this works, I will definitely use this site again, but for one of those more noble causes I wrote about earlier in this early morning rambling. If you can donate to the cause, please email me via the link below.

Thanks for looking and for your donations.

DG

http://www.gofundme.com/group-therapy

"The SIG SAUER® SP2022® is the latest version of our popular polymer framed pistol and features a durable, lightweight and wear-resistant polymer frame with the added tactical versatility of an integrated accessory rail. The slide is machined from a solid block of stainless steel and protected by SIG’s black Nitron® finish. Available in 9mm, and .40 S&W, the SP2022 can easily be converted from a Double-Action/Single-Action to a Double-Action Only configuration through a unique integral fire control unit. It also features the SIG SAUER four-point safety system. The SIG SAUER polymer framed pistols has earned an enviable reputation and proven track record of reliable performance in the hands of law enforcement professionals. In December of 2004 the U.S. Army Tank-automotive and Armaments Command at the Rock Island Arsenal awarded SIG SAUER a contract for 5,000 SIG SAUER SP2022 pistols chambered in 9mm. "The SIG SAUER® SP2022® is the latest version of our popular polymer framed pistol and features a durable, lightweight and wear-resistant polymer frame with the added tactical versatility of an integrated accessory rail. title: For Trade:  I Need an AR!!!
postcontent:
My Colt is going in the safe for a while, I need another AR platform to use in the field. Open to brand/make/model, just be realistic with your prices. I can get a S&W for $599 with my military discount. 

What I'm putting up for trade:

Kahr P9, LNIB, two tone, one mag, in the box with paperwork. Tritium sights, very nice pistol. 

XD40, good condition, maybe 1000 rounds through it. Comes in original box with all the XD gear it came with. Has some holster marks, as I do carry it.  

Savage .17 hmr with BSA Sweet 17 scope. Near mint condition, this rifle will put every round through the same hole at 100. One of my favorite rifles to shoot. 

Sporterized Mauser 8mm, all marks intact, including the Nazi Waffen mark. Has an old 4X scope, will shoot 2" at 100 with whatever ammo you put in it. No deer has survived a hit from this rifle. 

1954 Marlin 39a .22. Was an attic find, has a little rust, and a broken extractor spring. Shoots straight, and has killed plenty of critters around the farm. 

Few old 12 and 20 single shots, in decent, working order. They just sit in the safe.  

Some misc. reloading supplies. Have a tumbler, some dies, press, old powder measure, etc. LOTS of Lake City brass, .308 and .223, as well as a whole box of sorted misc rounds. 

Come up with what you think is fair. Single item, or a combination. Nothing I posted here is used regularly, I'm ready to wheel and deal. I am NOT looking to add cash at this time. I could go sell a couple items and go buy a new rifle, figured I'd see what anybody has on here first. All laws apply, I have a foid, so should you. I'm 30 years old, disabled Army veteran, no BS here.

title: For Sale:  Delusional
postcontent:
I will just laugh and shake my head at the fact that lots of you guys posting adds here are delusional in what you asking for used crap. Armslist if a forum for non dealers to list guns in a classified style environment for resale. Not for vultures to try and gouge unsuspecting and uneducated gun buyers. Crappy ass Beretta 92 for retail, aslo, ALL Berettas' are made in Italy, stop making it seem exotic so you can ask more, same all Glocks are made in Austria, but you never see some one list a Glock and feel the need to post the tid bit of info. 10/22s with cheap scopes and 20 dollar mags being sold for more that retail. SKS's with gun show garbage, AR's with every piece of NCstar crap bolted on. Please, for the love of puppies, deep dish pizza, and all things related to Anne Hathaway's amazing rack. Go to gunbrioker.com, or cheaperthandirt.com and at least get an idea of what retail is, then adjust for depreciation. That is the biggest thing that people don't realize. Guns are just like cars, once you take them off the lot, they go down in value. I have worked at gun stores in Texas, Alaska, and Colorado and the scene here in Indiana is fucking driving me crazy.

p.s. those are my daughters, so I don't want to hear your crying either. Thank you, have a nice day.

title: Want To Buy:  Dream AR
postcontent:
Dream AR Build

I'm Dave, a disabled veteran who enjoys target shooting, or as I call it; "Group Therapy." I have been working on my dream AR build; basically a fully automatic rifle just like the rifles carried by our brave men and women in the armed forces every day...and very much like the one I carried when I had the honor and privilege to serve in the U.S. Army. In short, building a fully automatic custom AR is quite expensive involving government laws, regulations and of course taxes, tariffs and fees. While doing research early one morning, since sleep eluded me once more and which just so happens to be Veteran's day, (HOOAH!), I stumbled up this website and figured why not?!?

Now I know there are A LOT more noble causes and better reasons to donate money and I'm not asking anyone to give who is anti-gun, or does not have a few dollars to throw this way toward this nut, but as always and especially if I succeed with this crazy endeavor, I invite all my family and friends to join me at the range and shoot this and every other firearm I own. Truth be told I am a little embarrassed I did this, but since I already linked it to my Facebook account and it posted an update on my timeline, I’m already committed!

So if you can; GREAT! If you can’t, wish me luck and for those of you that know me know I will document every step of this journey in writing and of course, with pictures. J  Please feel free to spread the word as I’m curious to see how many like-minded people there are out there.

If this works, I will definitely use this site again, but for one of those more noble causes I wrote about earlier in this early morning rambling. If you can donate to the cause, please email me via the link below.

Thanks for looking and for your donations.

DG

http://www.gofundme.com/group-therapy

postcontent:
Dream AR Build

I'm Dave, a disabled veteran who enjoys target shooting, or as I call it; "Group Therapy." I have been working on my dream AR build; basically a fully automatic rifle just like the rifles carried by our brave men and women in the armed forces every day...and very much like the one I carried when I had the honor and privilege to serve in the U.S. Army. In short, building a fully automatic custom AR is quite expensive involving government laws, regulations and of course taxes, tariffs and fees. While doing research early one morning, since sleep eluded me once more and which just so happens to be Veteran's day, (HOOAH!), I stumbled up this website and figured why not?!?

Now I know there are A LOT more noble causes and better reasons to donate money and I'm not asking anyone to give who is anti-gun, or does not have a few dollars to throw this way toward this nut, but as always and especially if I succeed with this crazy endeavor, I invite all my family and friends to join me at the range and shoot this and every other firearm I own. Truth be told I am a little embarrassed I did this, but since I already linked it to my Facebook account and it posted an update on my timeline, I’m already committed!

So if you can; GREAT! If you can’t, wish me luck and for those of you that know me know I will document every step of this journey in writing and of course, with pictures. J  Please feel free to spread the word as I’m curious to see how many like-minded people there are out there.

If this works, I will definitely use this site again, but for one of those more noble causes I wrote about earlier in this early morning rambling. If you can donate to the cause, please email me via the link below.

Thanks for looking and for your donations.

DG

http://www.gofundme.com/group-therapy

SOLD TO A NICE GUY FROM THE MIDLANDS


Up for sale is my brand new PSA AR-15.  I was given this as a gift.  It has the fully chrome-lined barrel (mid-length gas pick) up with PSA premium barrel.  It is chambered for 5.56 (.223).  It has M-16 bolt carrier group.  The lower is their standard with MOE grips.  Receiver and fore-end are fully fully railed.  In addition, the gun is sold with the following:

100+ rounds of 5.56mm and .223

title: For Sale:  Glock 26 Gen3 9mm Used
postcontent: I bought my wife a Sig P232 for her birthday.  She shot it once and said she preferred MY Glock 26.  I carry MY Glock 26 for plain clothes duty - so, I traded the Sig for this used Glock 26 and for almost a year, it has sat in my safe. title: For Sale/Trade:  Springfield Armory MC Operator .45
location: South Colorado Springs, Colorado Springs, Colorado
postcontent:
For sale is a excellent condition Springfield MC Operator. I bought this about 3 months ago from my friend who bought it brand new in 2010. It has been VERY well taken care of, looks just about new in box and has around 500 total rounds through it. These are very hard to find and sought after production 1911's with a hint of custom in them. The MC Operators are made and finished in the US and have the NM serial number and made in USA markings versus the Imbel Brazil markings like the lower and middle end Springer 1911's. The slide and frame see some handfitting and the slide has the gunsmith's number engraved on the inside of it. 

Features novak sights with trijicon tritium night sights, true 1913 picatinny rail, Storm Lake match grade barrel, bushing, and trigger, pachymayr combat grips, and the armory kote finish. Comes with factory box, manual, lifetime transferable warranty plus I am including a kydex belt holster, x4 7rd steel magazines, and 100 rounds of .45 ACP in the price. Price IS firm however and please no trades at this time. FTF in Co springs or surrounding area, must be legal to own a handgun in CO. contact me with any questions, thanks for taking a look!

title: For Sale:  U.S. Springfield Model 1896 Krag Bolt Action Rifle
postcontent:
This remarkable rifle, the U.S. Springfield Model 1896 Krag .30 - 40 Army Bolt Action , Has the original barrel dust cap, strap and built in cleaning kit. It has not been cleaned, yet the rifling looks superb!
Make: Springfield Armory

Model: 1896

Serial Number: 66382

Caliber: .30 Army (.30-40 Krag)

Action Type: Bolt Action Rifle, Internal Magazine

Markings: The left side of the frame is marked "U. S. / Model 1896 Springfield armory. 66382". There is a circle "P" on the wrist of the stock, behind the lower tang.

Barrel Length: 30"

Sights / Optics: This rifle is mounted with a blade on a base front sight and a windage and elevation adjustable ladder style rear sight.

Stock Configuration & Condition: The stocks are oil finished wood. The wood shows a nicely aged dark appearance with minimal scattered dings and marks. The stocks rate in about Very Good overall condition.

Type of Finish: Blue

Bore Condition: The bore is dark, with minor rust specs and the rifling is visible the entire length, but worn. There is not much erosion or pitting throughout the bore.

Mechanics: The action functions correctly. We have not fired this rifle. 

Box, Paperwork & Accessories: None 

The Springfield Model 1892-99 Krag-Jørgensen rifle is a Norwegian-design bolt action rifle that was adopted in 1892 as the standard United States Army military longarm, chambered in U.S. caliber .30-40 Krag. All versions and variants were manufactured under license by the Springfield Armory between 1892 and 1903. The U.S. Krag was replaced beginning in 1903 with the introduction of the M1903 Springfield rifle. The 1896 is amongst the rarer of the Krags, and this is certainly an acceptable example for a collection.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Manurhin P1 9mm w/Leather Flap Holster and 2 mags (Walther)
postcontent:
For Sale for $475 cash or trade for $550 value my
Manurhin P1 9mm semi-auto with 2 mags, flap holster. 
A variation of the the P38, the P1 was one of the world's first true double-action pistol and proved to be an exceptional military pistol. The weapon is robust, accurate and well balanced and field stripping and maintenance are simple and rapid. The P1 uses a double-action trigger design similar to that of the earlier Walther PPKs, and a loaded chamber indicator is also incorporated. The fixed-barrel design mechanism operates by use of a wedge-shaped locking block underneath the breech. The standard safety also acts as a decocker, and is located at the left side of the slide. When German manufacturer Walther was no longer able to produce firearms after World War II thanks to Allied sanctions, they passed the design and materials for the P38 and P1 over to French firearms company Manurhin. This pistol is import-marked and features synthetic grips, fixed open sights, and an 8-round magazine. Its grips, metal, and bore are all in very good condition.

title: For Sale:  Ruger 10 22 Muzzelite Bullpup Rifle Stock
postcontent:
I am selling a muzzelite bullpup stock for a ruger 10/22. I have only fired less than 100 rounds with it on the gun. It is still in great shape. I decided to go with more of a traditional style with my rifle. Willing to consider trade if you have something I want. Otherwise I am asking $85.00 will ship for $95.00.

The most striking feature of the MUZZELITE bullpup stock, when attached to your action, is the overall length of 26-1/2". This allows you to carry the rifle with much greater mobility. Whether your sport is hunting or plinking, the MUZZELITE bullpup stock will convert a long rifle into a compact weapon system in just a matter of minutes!

The stock itself has fixed sights which are adjustable for windage and elevation. The windage is done with the rear sight and the elevation is done with the front sight. The stock also comes equipped with a scope mount which attaches in the handle.

Construction is of fiberglass reinforced plastic and fits stander barrels and heavyweight barrels (with minor modifications).

title: For Sale:  JENNINGS / Calwestco (Irvine) J25
postcontent:
I have a Jennings / Calwestco (Irvine) J25 (ser. no. 009839) and am looking for a collector interested in buying it, as this is its only legitimate value.

It appears to be in good condition. I have not fired it, but I have torn it down completely and thoroughly cleaned it. It seems to function fine and there is no obvious wear or defect. There was also very little residue of any kind in either the action, chamber or barrel, indicating to me that it has had very little use.

It has a nickle finish and walnut grips, both of which are in very good, though not new condition.

It is in its original box and comes with two mags and the original information booklet.

Please contact me if you are interested.
